alert.note: Alert for Callahan; Runnels; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 7:54PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Callahan, northwestern Brown, northern Coleman, southeastern Taylor and northeastern Runnels Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 752 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from Bradshaw to Goldsboro, or near Cross Plains, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cross Plains, Lawn, Novice, Burkett, Bradshaw, Silver Valley, Oplin, Echo, Lake Coleman, Ovalo, Drasco, Goldsboro and Us- 283 Near The Coleman-Callahan County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
